descriptions: Student is unable to count beyond single digits or struggles significantly to start from a given number.
Student can count to some extent but makes frequent errors or requires significant prompting to continue from a given number.
Student can count to 120 from a given number but may make occasional errors or hesitate.
Student can accurately count to 120 from any given number with minimal errors or hesitation.
Student confidently and accurately counts to 120 from any given number and demonstrates understanding of the counting sequence.
Student fluently and accurately counts beyond 120 from any given number, demonstrating a strong grasp of number sequencing.
Student cannot identify or write numerals beyond single digits.
Student can identify and write some numerals but struggles with two-digit numbers.
Student can read and write numerals up to 120 with some errors.
Student accurately reads and writes numerals up to 120 with minimal errors.
Student consistently reads and writes numerals up to 120 accurately.
Student can accurately read, write, and represent numerals beyond 120, demonstrating a comprehensive understanding of number representation.
Student is unable to represent numbers with objects or does so incorrectly.
Student attempts to represent numbers with objects but makes significant errors.
Student can represent numbers with objects but requires assistance or makes some mistakes.
Student accurately represents numbers up to 120 with objects, demonstrating a basic understanding of quantity.
Student accurately and efficiently represents numbers up to 120 with objects, showing a clear understanding of quantity.
Student can represent numbers beyond 120 with objects and explain their reasoning, demonstrating a strong understanding of number concepts.
